harp module¶

Summary:

This is the starting file for HARP. It also extends the QMainWindow and acts as the main control of the GUI.

Allows the user to setup a config file in the first tab. This is then saved and added to a processing list. Multiple config files can be generated and added to the list. The list can then be processed and the status checked by looking at the processing tab.

USAGE: python harp.py or if using executable in windows .harp.exe or clicking on the harp.exe icon.

NOTE: QT Designer automatically uses mixed case for its class object names e.g radioButton. This format is not PEP8 but has not been changed.

class harp.MainWindow(app)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QMainWindow

Class to provide the GUI end of HARP.

Extends the QMainWindow class (from mainwindow.py) generated by QT Designer

Constructor: Checks the buttons which have been pressed and responds accordingly.

Parameters:

app (object) – QtGui.QApplication
Variables:
  • self.modality (str) – Changes based on the modality chosen. Value should be either ‘MicroCT’ or ‘OPT’
  • self.stop (boolean) – If True HARP stops pre-processing steps. Wont let the user go process the recon
  • self.stop_pro_switch (int) – If value 1 HARP stops processes due to user pressing stop
  • self.count_in (int) – Count used for processing table. Initialized at 0
  • self.current_row (int) – Row for processing table. Initialized at 0
  • self.scan_folder (str) – Scan path. Initialized as ‘NA’ to indicate no data
  • self.recon_log_path (str) – Recon log path. Initialized as ‘NA’ to indicate no data
  • self.f_size_out_gb (str) – File size (in GB). Initialized as ‘’ to indicate no data
  • self.pixel_size (str) – Pixel size. Initialized as ‘’ to indicate no data
about_message()[source]¶

Short description about what HARP is and its version

add_more()[source]¶

When the add more button is pressed should switch back to the first tab

Uses the radio button pushButtonAdd

If there are other OPT channels available tell the user if they want to analyse them as well. If they do the GUI is updated as if this channel has been manually selected.

See also

reset_inputs(), autofill_pipe()

This adds the recon information onto the “processing tab” also saves a pickle file which includes all the parameter information.

Uses the methods in the autofill module.

Parameters:suppress (boolean) – True if suppression of popup dialog box warnings is required
Variables:self.crop_box_use (boolean) – True if a derived croping box is to be used

choose_channel_for_crop(event)[source]¶

Allows the user to select which channel to use to determine crop dimensions

If the return button is pressed on a certain row of the opt list this recon will be used for the automatic crop

Parameters:event (qt_event) – qt event to be processed for opt channel select
closeEvent(event)[source]¶

Overides QMainWindow closeEvent

NOTE: Function name has to be mixed case format as it is from qt

Performs a loop through the item list and checks if any process still running :param qt_event event: qt close event (when HARP is closed)

crop_call_back(box)[source]¶

Method to get crop dimension (crop box) from z projecion image.

Saves the crop dimensions to the line edit boxes on the GUI.

Parameters:box (list) – Crop dimensions (crop box) the user selected
crop_switch()[source]¶

Turns crop options on or off

Options enabled and disabled are based on the imaging modality and the current cropping option selected

delete_rows(event)[source]¶

Deletes a row from the processing list on the processing tab

If the delete button is pressed on a certain row the recon is taken off the list to be processed

Parameters:event (qt_event) – Key press event
Variables:self.count_in (int) – Used to monitor the number of rows in use (used in the addtolist module)

get_SPR_man()[source]¶

Get the SPR file manually. Uses the pushButtonCTSPR.

get_dimensions()[source]¶

Allow a user to choose crop dimensions by choosing a region based on the z-projection of the image.

This z projection is calculated on a seperate thread. Process is as follows:

  1. start_z_thread starts a thread using the module zproject
  2. z projection is performed in background giving updates to the “status” section of the GUI
  3. The zproject_slot catches any signals
  4. “Z-projection finished” is called and run_crop loads a new window.
  5. The user can then select the crop dimensions
  6. When the crop dimensions are selected the crop window is closed and the cropbox parameter is saved on the GUI

Two important modules used: crop.py and zproject.py

  • zproject performs the zprojection and displays the image.
  • crop.py then gets the dimensions to perform the crop

IMPORTANT NOTE: The cropping is not actually done here. This is just to get the dimensions.

Variables:self.stop (boolean) – If True HARP stops pre-processing steps. Set to None before z projection performed

See also

start_z_thread(),

get_recon_man()[source]¶

Get the recon folder manually.

Lets the user select a recon log file manually and then attempts to get the pixel size from the file given.

Used by the push button: pushButtonCTRecon

Variables:
  • self.recon_log_path (str) – Path of recon log, used again in the pickle file for documentation purposes
  • self.pixel (str) – Path of recon log, used again in the pickle file for documentation purposes
Raises:
  • TypeError – If self.pixel_size cannot be displayed on the GUI due to incorrect type
  • IOError – If file user selected does not exist

See also

autofill.get_pixel(),

When user changes the name of the folder manually This functions is deprecated as the the code almost always takes the input folder directly from the line edit box “lineEditInput” anyway.

Updates the instance variable input_folder when the line edit box lineEditInput text has changed

Parameters:text (str) – The text from lineEditInput after the text has been changed
Variables:self.input_folder (str) – input folder as text
kill_em_all()[source]¶

Function to kill all processes Emits a kill signal to the processing.py method kill_slot(. This is possible as the connection was setup in the method processing_thread()

man_crop_off()[source]¶

Disables boxes for cropping manually. Used by the radio buttons: radioButtonAuto, radioButtonUseOldCrop.

man_crop_on()[source]¶

Enables boxes for cropping manually. Used by the radio button: radioButtonMan.

Variables:self.output_folder (str) – output folder as text
processing_slot(message)[source]¶

listens to the child process and displays any messages.

Importantly it also recognises when processing is finished for a recon folder and instigates the setup of the processing of next recon folder on the list (using start_processing_thread)

Also updates the OPT channels table so it shows if one of the channels is processed.

Parameters:message (str) – The message sent from the processing thread

See also

processing.ProcessingThread(), autofill.get_channels()

Reset the parameter inputs to blank

reset_screen()[source]¶

Reset screen back to default

resize_screen()[source]¶

Resize screen for smaller monitors

run_crop(img_path)[source]¶

Creates the a window to display the z projection used to get crop dimensions

Creates an object from the crop module. Uses a call back method to get the crop dimensions after the user has selected them.

See also

crop.Crop() crop_call_back()

scale_by_pixel_on()[source]¶

Enables boxes for scaling by pixel

select_file_in()[source]¶

Selects input folder manually and some parameters are auto-filled if possible

If the the input folder is defined the parameters are reset, the ui.lineEditInput is updated and the autofill_pipe() method is performed which updates various parameters.

See also

reset_inputs(), autofill_pipe()

Updates the line edit box ui.lineEditOutput

start_processing()[source]¶

Starts a thread for processing after the user has pressed the ‘start button’ (GUI click only)

See also

start_processing_thread()

start_processing_thread()[source]¶

Starts a thread to perform all the processing in the background.

This monitors what recon folder we are processing based on the processing list on the processing tab.

Summary of steps:

  1. Check what the total memory is on the computer. And save as instance variable
  2. Go through a while loop to see what is the first recon folder on the list that needs processing
  3. Get the location of the relevant config object (config file)
  4. Setup a new thread using ProcessingThread to perform the processing in the background.
  5. When the processing signals are caught by the method processing_slot
  6. When the signal is sent to say processing is finished for specific recon folder. This method (start_processing_thread*) is run again processing the next recon on the list.
Variables:
  • self.p_thread_pool (tuple) – A tuple of the threads used. (Should only use 1 and then reset when we start again) NOTE: Potentially this should just be a class variable (i.e. not self) so would not need to be reset
  • self.stop_pro_switch (int) – If value 1 HARP stops processes due to user pressing stop. Set at 0 at start.
  • self.current_row (int) – The current row of processing. Set in the while loop of this method

See also

processing.ProcessingThread()

start_z_thread()[source]¶

Starts a thread to perform z projection processing in the background.

See also

zproject.ZProjectThread()

stop_processing()[source]¶

kills the current process

Variables:
  • self.p_thread_pool (tuple) – A tuple of the threads used. Reset here before the next process.
  • self.stop_pro_switch (int) – If value 1 HARP stops processes due to user pressing stop. Set at 1 here.

See also

kill_em_all(),

tab_change()[source]¶

Changes the tab view for the user.

On tab 0 (parameters) the qt KeyPressEvent is required for choosing the crop channel for OPT. On tab 1 (processing) the KeyPressEvent is used for deleting rows on the processing table.

They KeyPressEvent is therefore updated depending on what tab the user is on.

Also updates the OPT channels table each tab-change in-case anything has changed.

See also

choose_channel_for_crop(), delete_rows()

update_name()[source]¶

Update the name of the file and folder if the user has changed the name in the “identification” section

Used by push button: pushButtonUpdate.

Updates the output name by setting the text directly and updates the “identification” section using the autofill.get_name function.

See also

autofill.get_name(),

user_guide()[source]¶

Loads up pdf help file

For windows computers uses os.startfile. For linux requires Evince installed to view the pdf.

zproject_slot(message)[source]¶

Listens to the z projection child process.

Displays all messages to the status section of the parameters tab. Once zprojection is finished opens window to display zproject for user to get crop dimensions, using run_crop

See also

run_crop()
